title: Misconfiguration in Two Factor Authorisation

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Our team is busy triaging and fixing HackerOne reports, and it may take us up to 1 week (or more) to triage any given issue. Don't worry, we'll get to yours!

While you are waiting, you can read over our list of non applicable issues listed on our program page: https://hackerone.com/shopify. Make sure your issue isn't listed!

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

This authentication mechanism is working as intended. If you switch your shop to use Google Apps as your login service, then authentication is handled through your Google account, and you would need to configure your Google account to require two-factor authentication.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

This authentication mechanism is working as intended. If you switch your shop to use Google Apps as your login service, then authentication is handled through your Google account, and you would need to configure your Google account to require two-factor authentication.

activities.message:
@clayton Then why is Username and password still working even after setting up "Sign In with Google" ?

I don't get it, If what you are saying is correct only "Sign In with Google" should work after configuring it, while simple username and password should be disabled

Currently :
1. I use username and password with Two Factor Authorisation
2. Setup "Google Apps"
3. Anyone who knows my password can login into my account
4. Where did Google's two-factor-authentication come into play ?
activities.markdown_message:

  2. Setup "Google Apps"

  4. Where did Google's two-factor-authentication come into play ?

activities.message:
Hey @clayton @shopify
It's very disappointing when program does not read the full report and closes it as **N/A** and then ignores the comments

> If you switch your shop to use Google Apps as your login service, then authentication is handled through your Google account

This is quite incomplete reply and makes almost no sense

Here's my last attempt on describing the bug report while expecting a decent reply

#### Proof of Concept
 
**At this point there is no Google Apps activated in that store**
1. Victim A uses victim@googapps.com with password and 2FA to login (Thinks he is secure).

2. Victim A then activates "Sign In with Google" for his store.
3. Victim A logs in with Google (Still thinks he is secure, But he is not because Shopify's 2FA gets disabled without letting user know)

4. Now Attacker B who by chance knows the password of `victim@googapps.com` can login into the Admin Panel without 2FA **or access to Victim A's Google Account**

**Please note Attacker B does not require access to Google account, Just Email and Password of Shopify** because Email and Password is still valid even after activating "Sign In with Google"

**Also this is valid for accounts which once used Email and Password to login and then migrated to "Sign In with Google"**

#### Why ?
1. Because Shopify's 2FA gets disabled when you login with "Sign In with Google"
2. Traditional login with Email and Password does not get disabled when you activate "Sign In with Google"

#### Fix

1. If you are depending on Google Apps for security, Disable login with Email and Password for that store
2. Don't disable Shopify's 2FA when someone logs in with "Sign In with Google"
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @clayton @shopify
It's very disappointing when program does not read the full report and closes it as N/A and then ignores the comments

If you switch your shop to use Google Apps as your login service, then authentication is handled through your Google account

This is quite incomplete reply and makes almost no sense

Here's my last attempt on describing the bug report while expecting a decent reply

Proof of Concept

At this point there is no Google Apps activated in that store

  1. Victim A uses victim@googapps.com with password and 2FA to login (Thinks he is secure).

  2. Victim A then activates "Sign In with Google" for his store.

  3. Victim A logs in with Google (Still thinks he is secure, But he is not because Shopify's 2FA gets disabled without letting user know)

  4. Now Attacker B who by chance knows the password of victim@googapps.com can login into the Admin Panel without 2FA or access to Victim A's Google Account

Please note Attacker B does not require access to Google account, Just Email and Password of Shopify because Email and Password is still valid even after activating "Sign In with Google"

Also this is valid for accounts which once used Email and Password to login and then migrated to "Sign In with Google"

Why ?

  1. Because Shopify's 2FA gets disabled when you login with "Sign In with Google"
  2. Traditional login with Email and Password does not get disabled when you activate "Sign In with Google"

Fix

  1. If you are depending on Google Apps for security, Disable login with Email and Password for that store
  2. Don't disable Shopify's 2FA when someone logs in with "Sign In with Google"

vulnerability_information_html:
Hey

There seems to be a weird misconfiguration which leads to bypass of two factor authorisation

Scenario

  1. Let's assume you have setup Two Factor Authorisation with Google Authenticator

  2. You now activate Google Apps from Login services at https://shop-1.myshopify.com/admin/settings/account

  3. Now your try to "Sign In with Google" https://shop-1.myshopify.com/admin/auth/login?google_apps=1

What's weird is no two factor code is required and you directly land in Admin Panel

Issue

Issue here is Two Factor Authorisation is disabled as soon as you "Sign In with Google" and now you cannot even enable it because you can't see any Two Factor Authenticator Tab in Accounts

And now when you try to simple login with correct credentials you can access Admin Panel without Two Factor Code from Google Authenticator at https://shop-1.myshopify.com/admin/auth/login

Also there is no indication to via mail or notification that Two Factor Authorisation has been disabled when Two Factor Authorisation is disabled
While it shouldn't be disabled in the first place
vulnerability_information:
Hey

There seems to be a weird misconfiguration which leads to bypass of two factor authorisation

#### Scenario

1. Let's assume you have setup Two Factor Authorisation with Google Authenticator

2. You now activate `Google Apps` from `Login services` at https://shop-1.myshopify.com/admin/settings/account

3. Now your try to "Sign In with Google" `https://shop-1.myshopify.com/admin/auth/login?google_apps=1`

What's weird is no two factor code is required and you directly land in Admin Panel

#### Issue

Issue here is Two Factor Authorisation is disabled as soon as you "Sign In with Google" and now you cannot even enable it because you can't see any Two Factor Authenticator Tab in Accounts

And now when you try to simple login with correct credentials you can access Admin Panel without Two Factor Code from Google Authenticator at `https://shop-1.myshopify.com/admin/auth/login`

Also there is no indication to via mail or notification that Two Factor Authorisation has been disabled when Two Factor Authorisation is disabled
While it shouldn't be disabled in the first place
